intro: Strukeria, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. Strukeria typically grows in grasslands and open areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a subject of interest in horticultural studies.
